Key Match Events: The Celtics dominated the first quarter with 43 points, setting the tone for their victory.
Jayson Tatum scored 37 points, including 18 from three-point range, and contributed 10 assists and four rebounds.
The Knicks struggled to keep up, with Jalen Brunson and Miles McBride leading their scoring efforts but ultimately falling short.
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics celebrated raising their 18th championship banner before the game, symbolizing their recent success and determination to defend their title.
Jayson Tatum delivered a pre-game speech to the TD Garden crowd, emphasizing the team's gratitude and goal to win back-to-back championships.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics retained their core lineup from last season's championship team, positioning them well for a strong defense of their title.
The game was played at a packed TD Garden, creating a raucous atmosphere that fueled the Celtics' performance.
